A

Animal - Class in com.android
The subclassed classes will be used with the overloaded static FoodFactory method public static Food getFood(Animal myAnimal) This is the superclass of all Animals
Animal() - Constructor for class com.android.Animal
 
AnimalType - Enum in com.android
this enum is going to be used with the overloaded method of the FoodFactory class public static Food getFood(AnimalType type)
AnimalType() - Constructor for enum com.android.AnimalType
 

B

Bear - Class in com.android
this is a subclass of Canivore
Bear() - Constructor for class com.android.Bear
 

C

Carnivore - Class in com.android
this is a subclass of Animal
Carnivore() - Constructor for class com.android.Carnivore
 
com.android - package com.android
 
consumes() - Method in class com.android.Fish
overriden consumes method of the Food class
consumes() - Method in class com.android.Food
each type of Food is consumed in a different way, every class that extends Food has to have it's own consumes() method
consumes() - Method in class com.android.Hay
overriden consumes method of the Food class
consumes() - Method in class com.android.Meat
overriden consumes method of the Food class
consumes() - Method in class com.android.Vegetable
overriden consumes method of the Food class

E

ex1() - Static method in class com.android.Examples
this calls the first overloaded getFood method of the FoodFactory class Food getFood(String animalName) this is the method that would have the most problems as you can pass any string to this and also remember that strings are case sensitive, so "rabbit" is a different string to "Rabbit"
ex2() - Static method in class com.android.Examples
this calls the second overloaded getFood method of the FoodFactory class Food getFood(Animal myAnimal) This takes an Animal is enclosed and you can only send it a subclass of Animals and nothing else so less scope for issues with this.
ex3() - Static method in class com.android.Examples
this uses the Third overloaded method of the FoodFactory class Food getFood(AnimalType type) this takes a AnimalType enum typ and can only be one of these values POLARBEAR,RABBIT,GOAT,ZEBRA,LION again as it can only take these types it is more enclosed thatn one that takes a String and there is less scope for issues
Examples - Class in com.android
class that contain our examples that deal with three overloaded methods of the FoodFactory class
Examples() - Constructor for class com.android.Examples
 

F

Fish - Class in com.android
subclass of Food for feeding polar bears
Fish(int) - Constructor for class com.android.Fish
Constructor for the Fish Class that takes one int quantity argument
Food - Class in com.android
super abstract class for our food types Hay, Vegetable, Fish and Meat This food types are all eaten by certain types of Animal
Food(int) - Constructor for class com.android.Food
constructor for food object
FoodFactory - Class in com.android
this is a class that contains method that will return a different type of Food dependant on the type of Animal that needs to be feed, i.e Meat object for Lion, Fish for PolarBear we have three overloaded getFood() methods one takes a String one takes a Animal object One takes a Animaltype enum value
FoodFactory() - Constructor for class com.android.FoodFactory
 

G

getFood(Animal) - Static method in class com.android.FoodFactory
this method uses the Animal type object to determine what food is produced, this is a more enclosed systemt as this will limit you to the classes of Animal you have in the application (we have a Zebra, Lion, Goat,Rabbit,PolarBear classes and all of these are sub classes of Animal, so we can only use these types).
getFood(AnimalType) - Static method in class com.android.FoodFactory
this method uses an enum called AnimalType to determine what Food is produced.
getFood(String) - Static method in class com.android.FoodFactory
each one of these static methods return a food object, what type of food is dependant on what Animal is sent to this method, this is determined here at runtime via a case statement this method takes a String, depending on the string this will return one of these objects Hay, of two different quantities Vegetable Fish Meat this uses a String to determine what food object should be created
getQuantity() - Method in class com.android.Food
gets the quantity of food for the Animal
Goat - Class in com.android
this is a subclass of Herbivore

M

main(String[]) - Static method in class com.android.Main
the Factory pattern is also referred to as the "Factory Method Pattern" how do we create objects in which the precise type of object is not known until runtime.
Main - Class in com.android
class that contains our main method
